titles.title: The Martyrdom of St John (from the Martyrdom of the Twelve Apostles, a series of 12 prints)

historicEventInformations.remarks: Hortvlvs animae, Mit schönen lieblichen Figuren, Georg Rhau, Wittenberg, VD16 R 1687
Das Symbolum der Heiligen Aposteln... , Georg Rhau, Wittenberg

HORTVLVS ANIMAE.|| Lustgarten der See=||len: Mit scho?nen lieb=||lichen Figuren.|| (Das Symbolum der || heiligen Aposteln: || Darin der grund vnsers Christ=||lichen Glaubens gelegt || ist/ Ausgelegt || durch || D. Mart. Luth.|| ...) [Holzschnitte von Lukas Cranach d.Ä., Hans Brosamer und Anton Woensam], Georg Rhau Erben, Wittenberg, VD16 R 1691

HORTVLVS ANIMAE.|| Lustgarten der See=||len: Mit sch#[oe]nen lieb=||lichen Figuren.|| (Das Symbolum der || Heiligen Aposteln:|| darin der Grund vnsers Christ=||lichen Glaubens gelegt ist/|| Ausgelegt durch/|| D. Mart. Luth., Georg Rhau, Wittenberg (1547/1548), VD16 R 1683

¬Der¬ heiligen XII.|| Aposteln ankunfft/beruff/glauben/|| lere/ leben vnd seliges absterben etc. Aus || heiliger Schrifft vnd glaubwirdigen Hi=||storien/ auffs aller kürtzst zusamen || gestelt. Für die Leien vnd || Einfeltigen.|| Durch/|| Johannem Pollicarium/|| Prediger zu Weis=||senfels.||, Georg Rhau Erben, Wittenberg, 1549 [VD16 P 4031]

pageContext.description:
St John is shown descending into his burial vault behind the altar. The congregation is in the background and the two Saxon shields are represented at the back of the altar on the right.
Part of a series, 'The Martyrdoms of the Apostles', consisting of twelve sheets (Hollstein 53-64). Although the series was most likely intended to be published in its entity in a book context, no publication is known to exist until many years later, when it first was used as illustration to 'Das Symbolum oder gemeine Bekenntnis der zwelff Aposteln', Wittenberg, Georg Rhau, 1539. Galleys from about 1512 with text exist, printed with types from Reinhart's print shop, but subsequently the Martyrdoms were published as single sheets. An important prequel for this Martyrdom series are small woodcuts published in Hartmann Schedel's Weltchronik, Nürnberg 1493.

St Philip is shown hanging on the cross, surrounded by spectators. The two Saxon shields are represented on the right.
Part of a series, 'The Martyrdoms of the Apostles', consisting of twelve sheets (Hollstein 53-64). Although the series was most likely intended to be published in its entity in a book context, no publication is known to exist until many years later, when it first was used as illustration to 'Das Symbolum oder gemeine Bekenntnis der zwelff Aposteln', Wittenberg, Georg Rhau, 1539. Galleys from about 1512 with text exist, printed with types from Reinhart's print shop, but subsequently the Martyrdoms were published as single sheets. An important prequel for this Martyrdom series are small woodcuts published in Hartmann Schedel's Weltchronik, Nürnberg 1493.

St Bartholomew is shown bound to planks in the form of a cross at the centre and being flayed. The two Saxon shields are held by putti at the upper left.
Part of a series, 'The Martyrdoms of the Apostles', consisting of twelve sheets (Hollstein 53-64). Although the series was most likely intended to be published in its entity in a book context, no publication is known to exist until many years later, when it first was used as illustration to 'Das Symbolum oder gemeine Bekenntnis der zwelff Aposteln', Wittenberg, Georg Rhau, 1539. Galleys from about 1512 with text exist, printed with types from Reinhart's print shop, but subsequently the Martyrdoms were published as single sheets. An important prequel for this Martyrdom series are small woodcuts published in Hartmann Schedel's Weltchronik, Nürnberg 1493.

ref.description:
The beheaded body of St Paul lies in the right foreground, with blood flowing out. The head lies to the left, and springs appear at the places where the head had touched the ground. The two Saxon are represented at the upper left corner.
Part of a series, 'The Martyrdoms of the Apostles', consisting of twelve sheets (Hollstein 53-64). Although the series was most likely intended to be published in its entity in a book context, no publication is known to exist until many years later, when it first was used as illustration to 'Das Symbolum oder gemeine Bekenntnis der zwelff Aposteln', Wittenberg, Georg Rhau, 1539. Galleys from about 1512 with text exist, printed with types from Reinhart's print shop, but subsequently the Martyrdoms were published as single sheets. An important prequel for this Martyrdom series are small woodcuts published in Hartmann Schedel's Weltchronik, Nürnberg 1493.

Although the series was most likely intended to be published in its entity in a book context, no publication is known to exist until many years later, when it first was used as illustration to 'Das Symbolum oder gemeine Bekenntnis der zwelff Aposteln', Wittenberg, Georg Rhau, 1539. Part of a series, 'The Martyrdoms of the Apostles', consisting of twelve sheets (Hollstein 53-64). Although the series was most likely intended to be published in its entity in a book context, no publication is known to exist until many years later, when it first was used as illustration to 'Das Symbolum oder gemeine Bekenntnis der zwelff Aposteln', Wittenberg, Georg Rhau, 1539. ref.inscription: - text in Hebrew above the altarpiece in the background

dating.remarks: Das Symbolum der Heiligen Aposteln... , Georg Rhau, Wittenberg

ref.inscription:
in the upper margin: 'S. Johannes der Evangelist.';
 in the lower margin: 'Der Vierde Artickel. / Gelitten unter Pontio Pilato, Gecreuziget, Ge= / storben vnd begraben.'
